alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Iredell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 11:43PM EDT until July 16 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Alexander County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Northwestern Iredell County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 130 AM EDT. * At 1143 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Taylorsville, Stony Point, Love Valley, Lookout Shoals Lake, Lake Hickory, Hiddenite, Vashti, Scotts, Millersville and Union Grove. Continue to be wary of developing flooding and possibly road closures around greater Taylorsville. Flooding of low-lying areas from Hiddenite to Love Valley may also develop. This includes the highway 64 corridor and the headwaters of select tributaries in Western Iredell County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
